text:
i think you're misinterpreting  of how to use an api?

an api is designed for you to send data to, how you collect said data is up to you?

this should help you: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/forms_overview>

HubSpot has 3 types of webhooks:
1. webhook subscriptions on the application
    ◦ these send what HubSpot item it affects and can be triggered on deletion, creation and property changes
2. workflow webhooks (operations hub professional only) 
    ◦ these send the full data of the affected HubSpot object to your integration
3. HubSpot workflow extension objects
    ◦ similar to workflow webhooks, but they're managed on the application, they're extension triggers on the workflow and have a different format on how HubSpot sends the data 
you might need some custom behaviour between your workflow and your google cloud, when you receive a webhook and how you should interact with google cloud's api.

Thanks, ok. I guess it's the second type i'm interested in. What do you mean by custom behaviour between workflow and google cloud? I was thinking I am defining the action in google cloud, which is triggered in the workflow by http request.
Thank you for your answer but I wrote the question almost one year ago, so I don't need help anymore!
Is it possible to link a file as attachment using the API?
Thank you sir! That did help a lot, actually. I had to eventually set up a chat with HubSpot so they could go into their back-end and delete the object from their database.

Is there a way to `GET` a list of companies (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies>) in bulk instead of getting paginated results in batches of up to 100 and iterating through each batch?
hello good how can I get the products associated with my business?

<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/quotes/34532545/associations/line_item>

I use this endpoint there, I get the list of products, but it only returns the id of each product, but I need the name, quantity and price of the products, who can help me?
